page.title: 07Standon May Day
page.content:
In Standon May Day is celebrated in two ways.
On the first of May the Standon Morris men dance the Sun up around the Pudding stone at 5.30 a.m., there-after dancing down the High Street.Another old Hertfordshire custon which is observed is the placing of sprigs of may on people's doors. After breakfast they dance round the local villages,from pub to pub,finishing at the High Street public houses.
The other event is held during the first week-end of May.
Starting at 2.00 p.m. the church bells are rung for half an-hour.Then from the Pudding Stone a procession of children carring garlands, followed
